title: 114_hr6055
content: The Act titled "Fairness in Political Advertising Act of 2016" mandates the allocation of free broadcast time for political advertising to political candidates. The Act mandates free broadcast time for political advertising on television broadcast stations, with license renewal subject to compliance. License renewal for licensees who fail to comply with political advertising requirements will not be renewed, but no other sanctions will apply. Licensees must provide equal free broadcast time to qualified political candidates, with a minimum of 2 hours every even-numbered year. Television stations may allocate time based on the population of the district they cover. The free broadcast time allotted to political candidates must be composed of units of varying lengths, with at least half broadcast during the hours of 7:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. and a majority aired in the weeks leading up to election day. The free broadcast time allotted to political candidates must be comparable in duration to other candidates, with a limit of 4.5 hours per week for political advertising. Candidates must speak directly to the camera in unedited segments during this broadcast time. The candidate must speak directly to the camera during free broadcast time allotted for political advertising, with specific qualifications for being considered a qualified political candidate. SEC. 3. CABLE BROADCASTING OF POLITICAL ADVERTISING. Section 611 of the Communications Act of 1934 is amended to require cable operators to provide free cable time for political advertising in accordance with regulations set by the Commission. Failure to comply may result in the non-renewal of a cable operator's franchise.
